main.name: Stephanie George
main.description: Here will be your description. Use this to describe what you do or whatever you feel best describes yourself to a potential employer
main.bio: I hold the belief that if we design with the user in mind we can't lose. I'm driven by a desire to solve business problems by focussing on customer needs. I'm goal oriented and passionate but I don't take myself too seriously. I also hate talking about myself. I love creating art and listening to music in my free time. Some of my art can be found on my Instagram and my many playlists can be found on Spotify (both are linked above).
main.contactmessage: Here is where you should write your message to readers to have them get in contact with you.

resume.skillmessage: Through work, school and personal projects I have gained skills in:

education.description: My ultimate goal in going back to school was to learn more about design, strategy and leadership. Through this program I have been exposed to the major concepts of UX/UI design such as visual communication, user research, information architcture and user-centric design. Along with this I have learned how to balance my time, adapt and collaborate remotely on group projects.

During my time at Saint Louis University I was able to gain a wholistic education while majoring in Copmuter Science. I learned the fundamentals of software development while studying graphic design, art, ethics and Shakespeare. I was also able to hold leadership roles and collaborate in various teams for projects and extra cirriculars. Through this I learned how to be an authetncic, servant leader as well as a team player.

work.title: User Researcher
work.description: Applying design thinking concepts and user research practices to create new narratives for a start up tech company. Though this experience I have gained strengths in active listening, empathy and qualitative analytics to define personas and help build new strategies.

work.title: Digital Leadership Program Associate
work.description: Working as a rotational associate for the digital sector of an aerospace company. This requires me to move to a new state and start a new job within the company every eight months. Although I have gained important experience in software engineering and project management I have gained invaluable skills such as adapatability and comfort with ambiguity.
